perturbation.original_text: 2.8 "Technology E-Commerce (or E-Tail)" means the Arena partnership category that Allied is granting to Newegg and is defined as including technology-focused products in categories including computer systems, components, electronics, gaming, networking, office solutions, software & services, automotive and industrial, home and tools, health & sports, and hobbies and toys. For purposes of clarity, this does not include apparel and accessories.
perturbation.changed_text: 2.8 "Technology E-Commerce (or E-Tail)" means the Arena partnership category that Allied is granting to Newegg and is defined as including technology-focused products in categories including computer systems, components, electronics, gaming, networking, office solutions, software & services, automotive and industrial, home and tools, health & sports, and hobbies and toys. For purposes of clarity, this *does* include apparel and accessories branded with Newegg logos.
perturbation.explanation: This change creates a contradiction regarding whether apparel and accessories are included in the definition of 'Technology E-Commerce (or E-Tail)'. This is significant because it could impact which products Newegg has exclusive sponsorship rights over.

perturbation.original_text: 14.1 Failure by Allied to perform and comply with any of its obligations in sections 5, 6, 7, 9, 11, 12 and 13 of this Agreement shall be deemed a material breach of this Agreement and Newegg shall have the right to terminate this Agreement immediately if Allied fails to cure the breach within fifteen (15) days following Newegg's written notice of the breach.
perturbation.changed_text: 14.1 Failure by Allied to perform and comply with any of its obligations in sections 5, 6, 7, 9, 11, 12 and 13 of this Agreement shall be deemed a material breach of this Agreement and Newegg shall have the right to terminate this Agreement immediately if Allied fails to cure the breach within thirty (30) days following Newegg's written notice of the breach.
perturbation.explanation: The original text states a 15-day cure period for breaches, while the modified text extends it to 30 days. This creates an internal contradiction, making it unclear which timeframe applies for curing a breach and avoiding termination, which would affect the rights and obligations of each party involved.

perturbation.original_text: 15.4 Assignment. Neither Newegg nor Allied shall have the right or power to assign or transfer any part of its rights or obligations under this Agreement without the prior consent in writing of the other Party.
perturbation.changed_text: 15.4 Assignment. Newegg shall have the right to assign or transfer any part of its rights or obligations under this Agreement without the prior consent in writing of Allied, but Allied shall not have that right.
perturbation.explanation: This modifies the text to create contradictory language on who is allowed to assign or transfer its rights or obligations under the agreement without written consent. This change creates an unequal obligation between both parties, which may lead to legal disputes.
